About us

Learn more

Our Story

Community Helpers of Rutherford County (CHORC), a non-profit and partner agency of United Way Rutherford/Cannon, was established in 1981 by Ms. Jo Call, a member of St. Rose of Lima Catholic Church, Murfreesboro, TN. She, a small board, and a few community volunteers saw a needed to help others when struggling financially and served 100 families the first year. After 40 years, CHORC continues to serve Rutherford County’s citizens during an economic hardship with the community’s support.CHORC helps prevent homelessness, maintains a healthy home, and connects people to local resources for the opportunity of long-term financial stability. With every client, we attempt to go beyond solving their immediate need, connecting to resources to provide long-term solutions.

Volunteer Connect

Visit Volunteer Connect website for volunteer opportunities. Help Us, help others in our community prevent homelessness & maintain a healthy home.

Our partner

We meet immediate needs when possible but partner with other community agencies for help and long-term solutions to the client’s situation, if appropriate. The partnerships used by Community Helpers include:
